Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2015 04:47PM Cathy044 wrote: I figured. I know the doctors can't really say anything but I wish they would. The waiting is so hard and most women I'm sure rush home, Google all they can and come up with their own (incorrect) assumptions
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy Today Cathy044 LisaAlissa

Posts.Content: Cathy044 wrote: I had my core biopsy today for suspicious calcifications in my left breast. The biopsy was a piece of cake but I do have a little after pain. I had the doctor point out the calcifications on the screen for me to see. It's a tight circle of microcalfiations. Any clue from that as to the chances of it being benign or not? They also only had to go in once to get samples which does concern me a little since I'm assuming with benign material they would go in a few times to make sure? Any opinions on that? Now I need to wait 3 business days on results - probably Monday they said Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy Today Cathy044 LisaAlissa
